remarks: Lemma for ~ psgnuni .  An odd-length representation of the identity is impossible, as it could be repeatedly shortened to a length of 1, but a length 1 permutation must be a transposition.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 25-Aug-2015.)
statement:
psgnunilem4.g $e |- G = ( SymGrp ` D ) $.
psgnunilem4.t $e |- T = ran ( pmTrsp ` D ) $.
psgnunilem4.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. V ) $.
psgnunilem4.w1 $e |- ( ph -> W e. Word T ) $.
psgnunilem4.w2 $e |- ( ph -> ( G gsum W ) = ( _I |` D ) ) $.
psgnunilem4 $p |- ( ph -> ( -u 1 ^ ( # ` W ) ) = 1 ) $.
